body_content.explanation: a tool for digging up plants:
examples: A daisy grubber is specially designed for dealing with troublesome daisies without damaging the lawn.
Grubbers are also very useful for breaking up soil.

body_content.explanation: in rugby, a forward kick of the ball along the ground:
examples: Jon Greene's grubber was crucial in England's win over Australia.
St Helens were caught out by Cooke's grubber kick rebounding off their player.

body_content.explanation: in cricket, an occasion when the ball is bowled (= thrown to the batter) and does not move up as much as normal when it hits the ground:
examples: I was bowled by a grubber.
He was fortunate enough to get his bat down in time to stop a grubber.

body_content.explanation: someone who tries to get something, usually in a way that is not pleasant or not honest:
examples: These are good times for power grubbers trying to gain dominance over others.
If you give teachers gifts the day before report cards come out, your child will look like a grade grubber!
